page.title: 07Memories of the War.
page.content: I interviewed a local family and they told me that after the war they were rationing food and clothes, and when you went out you still had to keep an eye out for bombs that hadn't gone off.You could buy army blankets very cheaply so you could make winter coats out of them.They still had cars, but open roofed ones with starting handles, and they weren't very comfortable and they were slow.{ {MEALS; Breakfast=porridge,Dinner=Wild {rabbit or sausage meat,with home-grown {vegetables.Desert=rice pudding. {Tea=home-made jam, dripping cake, {home-made butter and bread. You had to {milk your own cow in the morning and {at night.}On Market day you had to drive your animals along the road. Home-guard:They did a drill once a week and stood on guard all night. Written by {Lynne Hills
